snippet: Officials hope that a new complex in north-central Philadelphia will reconnect the area to the central business district.
abstract: Philadelphia city officials hope that plans for expansion of a Mormon complex along two blocks of north-central Philadelphia will reconnect the area to city’s core business district of Center City; development, due to be completed in 2016, will consist of 32-story tower, 13 rental homes and 24,000-square-foot meeting house for members of Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.
lead_paragraph: Officials hope that a new complex in north-central Philadelphia will reconnect the area to the central business district.

headline.main: Mormon Church to Expand Development in Philadelphia
headline.print_headline: Mormon Church to Expand Development in Philadelphia
